snippet.title: Armed robberies linked: Police
snippet.content: INVESTIGATORS believe a string of robberies by a man armed with a knife were committed by the same suspect. Police believe Gavin Rankin, 50, was behind three armed robberies in the past week, Rankin was captured on CCTV at a Darwin massage parlour and two service stations in the space of five days. Detective Acting Senior Sergeant Karl Day said Rankin allegedly held up the BP Palms service station. "The most recent incident involved a male entering the BP Palms service station just after 11pm yesterday and treating a staff member with a knife," he said. "The male fled the area with a quantity of cash, food and cigarettes." Sen-Sgt Day said police believed Rankin was still in the Darwin area, but could travel interstate. "We are asking all members of the public, including service stations and licensed premises to be on the lookout for Gavin." Rankin is described as caucasian, 170cm tall and of medium build with short dark hair and possible facial hair. Sen-Sgt Day urged the public not to approach Rankin. Any sightings to police on 131 444 or Crime Stoppers on 1800 333 000.
